text: Pedro or Dennis is a champion open water
swimmer today while other competitors
are wearing wetsuits he'll take to the
water as the prisoners did with no
protective neoprene one of the most
challenging things is the water
temperature and the other challenge is
that the page changes every single day
just a few minutes into the swim Pedro
faces a fresh challenge
a strong Riptide is rushing through the
bay they call it the angrier Riptide it
can become very dangerous in five
minutes
riptides are so strong in the bay that
even Olympic swimmers can be pulled out
to sea
swimmers are being forced to abort the
cross
Toad's Wild Ride you just get the sauce
back before we had two completely
opposite currents playing the exact same
speed against each other
there would have been no safety boat for
Frank Morris and John and Clarence
Anglin but according to another Alcatraz
inmate both brothers were expert
swimmers we know the two brothers could
swim they grew up down in Ruskin Florida
and swam in the rivers in the ocean down
there if you have that experience of
swimming you know that you have to relax
don't fight the currents never fight the
chorus the mile and a half swim is an
awesome test of endurance
FBI case files suggest the fugitives
might have been able to match Pedro's
stamina in interviews with Alcatraz
inmates one claim that John Anglin
participated in the prison's
weightlifting program and that Clarence
Anglin was a star baseball player the
likelihood is that these guys were in
pretty good physical shape as they head
out on their journey that night Pedro
has completed this swim over 900 times
it was one of the most challenging
currents I've seen in ten years but
every crossing of the bay draws on skill
and stamina could the escapees have made
it I still believe that they had better
conditioned on this because it was calm
it was in the middle of the night Blue
Moon warmer water so you never know
[Music]
